image.altText: The 'pass go' square on a monopoly game board.

props.synopsis: Political parties usually get in trouble for breaking their election promises. But what happens when they keep a promise that never actually existed?

title.children: SA government error in your favour — collect $1 million

image.altText: Edan van Haren as a young boy smiling, wearing a striped T-shirt.

props.synopsis: Edan van Haren, a victim of child predator Maurice Van Ryn, says legal loopholes are allowing the confessed paedophile to protect his assets in superannuation to avoid paying compensation.

title.children: Paedophile declares bankruptcy to avoid paying $1.4m in damages

image.altText: A beekeeper with a bee smoker.

props.synopsis: Beekeepers on Kangaroo Island are demanding that biosecurity measures be boosted to prevent a deadly parasite from wiping out the island's world-famous bee sanctuary.

title.children: World-famous bee sanctuary under threat from destructive parasite

image.altText: Wombats in Robe

props.synopsis: A wombat has made its home in the main street of Robe, evidence of an influx of the animals in the South Australian fishing town.

title.children: Wombat makes home in main street bowls club amid habitat loss

image.altText: A black-and-white photo showing shirtless soldiers carrying another soldier on a stretcher near a large fig tree.

props.synopsis: Many of the Rats of Tobruk hailed from the Eyre Peninsula and, after years of work, their legacy has been commemorated by a very special tree taking root.

title.children: Tobruk fig planted in honour of the Rats of the Eyre Peninsula

image.altText: Ashleigh Richards of the Saints celebrates kicking a goal.

props.synopsis: After a tough start to the year, Geelong sit just outside the top eight and equal on points with the reining grand finalists.

title.children: Mid-season upsets shake up AFLW ladder

image.altText: Helly Easther-Smith looks at the camera inside a holiday rental.

props.synopsis: After a cold winter, a warm spring is often a welcome time for towns that rely heavily on tourism. But for regional South Australian coastal communities hit hard by the ongoing algal bloom, there's a feeling of concern about what should be a busy period.

title.children: SA coastal businesses concerned about algal bloom impact on summer tourism

image.altText: An Aboriginal man wearing a red flannelette shirt holds a yellow electric guitar and stands next to a drum kit and microphones.

props.synopsis: For Liam Tunkin, making music is about continuing his late father's legacy and sharing a dark part of Australia's history.

title.children: Bush band's song tells story of Maralinga atomic bomb tests

props.synopsis: Unless Australia lifts its ambitions, its "fair share" of carbon emissions will be spent 14 years early. With the government announcing a 2035 climate target this week, how high should the government aim?

title.children: 2036 is the year Australia is due to blow its carbon budget

image.altText: A rally in Sydney

props.synopsis: Rallies against racism and in support of Indigenous sovereignty coincide with mixed anti-government protests in major cities around the country.

title.children: Capital cities witness day of protest across political spectrum

image.altText: Submarine with Unites States flag is semi submerged in water

props.synopsis: The Albanese government will spend $12 billion on building a submarine and naval shipbuilding facility south of Perth under AUKUS, as doubts linger over the agreement's future.

title.children: Government pledges $12b for AUKUS facility it expects will be used by US

image.altText: Man in grey hoodie and grey beanie holds box of groceries

props.synopsis: A year after opening its doors, OzHarvest's first free supermarket in Adelaide says demand for food relief is greater than ever.

title.children: OzHarvest says more people seeking food relief amid cost-of-living pressures

image.altText: A trench containing the bodies of pigs and plastic waste.

props.synopsis: Footage taken at four South Australian piggeries shows animals confined in sow stalls and evidence of potential cannibalism.

title.children: Mass grave filmed at SA piggery tied to animal welfare investigation

image.altText: Woman stands straightening younger woman's hair who sits in chair infront of mirror.

props.synopsis: The "salon" is an op shop and the round-trip commute's a doozy, but Juliann Mutch is happy to go the extra distance to pamper her grateful Wilcannia clientele.

title.children: Outback hairdresser drives 1,000km just to 'spoil' her clients

image.altText: Richard Marles National Press Club speech

props.synopsis: Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles defends Australia's spending on defence as a percentage of GDP amid pressure for it to be lifted. Follow live.

title.children: Marles reluctant to outline percentage of GDP spent on defence

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Coalition wants Australia to spend $25b more on defence
Marles not surprised by pressure on PNG over defence deal
Focus on dollar figures, not GDP, Marles urges on defence spending

image.altText: Adam Scott and Britt Lower side-by-side in a scene in Severance.

props.synopsis: It is time for television's biggest night, the Emmy Awards. Workplace thriller Severance leads the pack with 27 nominations, while The Bear and Hacks will duke it out in the comedy categories. Follow live.

title.children: Severance leads stacked Emmy Awards with most nominations

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Who are our Australian nominees today?

image.altText: Jenna Ortega showing off the back of her dress, which is made up of large pearls and shiny objects

props.synopsis: The stars of the television industry are arriving at the Peacock Theater in Los Angeles. Here are some of the looks we've seen so far.

title.children: Emmys red carpet: Sparkles, unbuttoned shirts and a pair of Capricorn horns

image.altText: A lady looking at the camera

props.synopsis: According to the Transport Workers' Union, some rideshare drivers have reported being on the road for up to 18 hours a day, swapping between multiple apps in order to bypass fatigue restrictions.

title.children: Rideshare drivers bypassing fatigue restrictions as cost-of-living hits

image.altText: Four fully enclosed biohazard suits, two white, one orange and one yellow, hanging up.

props.synopsis: Step into one of Australia's few biosafety level 4 facilities, where scientists handle highly transmissible and potentially lethal pathogens such as Ebola and Hendra virus.

title.children: Behind these airlocked doors, Australian scientists study deadly diseases

image.altText: A white man and white woman sitting in a kitchen looking at the camera

props.synopsis: New report finds mothers do more of the sex education at home, raising concerns that young boys are missing out on key information from their dads.

title.children: Dads avoid sex talks with kids amid concern about online content

image.altText: Raelene Cooper wears a shirt that reads 'save our songlines' and is standing outside in front of rock formations

props.synopsis: Environment Minister Murray Watt approved the extension of Australia's biggest gas project last week.

title.children: Traditional custodian readies for 'challenge' over North West Shelf extension

image.altText: A woman on a man's shoulders, both smiling, out the front of a stadium. She has an Aussie flag in hand, he has a yellow wig.

props.synopsis: Largely regarded as one of the most successful modern Olympics, years of work went into ensuring Sydney could fully capitalise on its moment in the spotlight.

title.children: How the 2000 Olympics changed the face of Sydney

image.altText: Floodwater runs off road, side of road has slipped. People stand nearby to look at damage.

props.synopsis: Victorian councils say they are required to provide before-and-after photos of every 100 metres of road in order to be eligible for flood recovery funding.

title.children: Road repairs after flood delayed by 'excruciating' eligibility criteria

image.altText: Phoebe Litchfield plays a shot against India.

props.synopsis: Australia's Cricket World Cup preparations are in full swing as three batters score half-centuries in a big run chase in the first of three ODIs against India.

title.children: Litchfield stars and Healy returns as Australia beats India in World Cup warm-up

image.altText: A photo of a rectangular building wiith red bricks and many broken windows, on a grass surface with nearby bushes

props.synopsis: A retired nurse who worked at Moe Hospital says the closed facility could be used for housing rather than left to further rot.

title.children: Trashed former hospital site hits market after years of decay

image.altText: A woman plays at an outdoor table with a young blonde girl.

props.synopsis: As a select cohort of WA GPs begins to diagnose ADHD in people older than 10, parents of younger children and some medical professionals have expressed concerns about the scheme.

title.children: Some WA doctors will soon start diagnosing ADHD, but parents have concerns

image.altText: ANZ

props.synopsis: ANZ has been hit with a massive fine for unconscionable conduct impacting 65,000 customers ranging from the federal government to dead account holders. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ANZ hit with $240m fine for 'unconscionable' conduct, ASX set to fall

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ANZ agrees to record penalty for 'unconscionable' conduct
ANZ hit with $240 million fine for unconscionable conduct
Nasdaq powers ahead, S&P 500 flat ahead of Fed decision, ASX to retreat

image.altText: Hand holds a glass of pink coloured wine.

props.synopsis: Producers in Western Australia's premier wine region say the state government's expanded bottle recycling scheme is set to cost them millions of dollars.

title.children: Wineries, distilleries worry about costs to add bottles to deposit scheme

image.altText: Sam Kerr smiles on the pitch after a Chelsea WSL game.

props.synopsis: Matildas star Sam Kerr scores her 100th goal for Chelsea just minutes after returning to the pitch for the Blues for her first game since 2023.

title.children: Sam Kerr notches century of goals in long-awaited return from injury

image.altText: A woman is seen from behind and through some fabric hanigng out clothing on a washing line.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne mother-of-two says she waited eight years for a suitable public housing home after fleeing family violence.

title.children: 'The situation is so dire': Survivors of family violence wait years for housing

image.altText: A surfer rides a giant wave.

props.synopsis: Record-breaking surfer and Paralympic cycling gold medallist Matt Formston's feats are brought to life in a dance performance by students in New South Wales.

title.children: Blind, big-wave surfer inspires hometown students

image.altText: Ricky Hatton standing in a boxing ring with boxing gloves on.

props.synopsis: The British boxer was a former world champion boxer and had been due to make a comeback in December this year.

title.children: Ricky Hatton, world champion boxer, dies at age 46

image.altText: Dr Meg O'Connell takes a selfie in front of a grey plane on an ice shelf.

props.synopsis: Expeditioners at Australia's Antarctic stations are taking part in a research project to better understand the impacts of extended deployments

title.children: Understanding 'brain shrink' at Antarctica could help astronauts
